KKBE is the second oldest synagogue building in the United States and the oldest in continuous use. Parking is free across the street during services (get your parking pass stamped at the lobby). There's a small museum, a gift shop, and a comprehensive Judaica library. The building's sound is awesome, especially when the pipe organ is in use.

KKBE is one of the oldest Jewish congregations in the U. S. Its building has been in continuous use longer than any other synagogue in the country. Jews came to South Carolina because it was the first colony to offer religious freedom to followers of all faiths. Te first Jew to be elected to public office anywhere in the world...

A must-see for Jewish visitors to Charleston, and for anyone interested in historic buildings and U.S. history.
